intro: Jaltomata nitida, commonly known as the silverleaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is characterized by its small, white or pale blue flowers that bloom in the morning. The plant has hairy, silver-gray leaves that give it its common name. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or stream sides. Jaltomata nitida is part of the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many species of flowering plants with vine-like growth habits.
